8  Appendix 3 
 
PROJECT PREPARATORY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE  
A.  Background and Justification 
1.  UTY conducted a prefeasibility study for the electrification of Marakand-Bukhara rail line 
(the Project) in 2013 and currently preparatory work for feasibility study are being conducted by 
the local design institute. Given the study’s inadequate information, a PPTA is recommended to 
prepare the Project. The PPTA will assist to improve the feasibility study to produce mutually 
agreed design and implementation arrangements suitable for ADB financing, including pre-
implementation works for the project. The government and UTY were advised that approval of 
the PPTA does not commit ADB to financing any ensuing project.

C.  Cost Estimate and Proposed Financing Arrangement  
3.  The total cost of the TA amounts to $445,000, of which $400,000 will be financed on a 
grant basis by ADB's Technical Assistance Special Fund (TASF-V). The Government through 
UTY  will  provide  counterpart  support  in  the  form  of  PIU  staff,  office  space  and  supplies, 
secretarial assistance, and other in-kind contributions. The value of the government contribution 
is estimated to account for 10% of the total TA cost. The detailed cost estimate is in Table A3.2.

D.  Consulting Services 
4.  The required positions and person-months are indicated in Table A3.3. The PPTA will 
require 14 person-months (PMs) international specialists and 17 PMs of national experts to be 
recruited individually. For project due diligence where feasibility study is under preparation by 
EA following government internal requirements, hiring individual consultants with short duration 
is more appropriate for quick mobilization of consulting service and cost-effective than firms to 
perform the assignment. The individual experts will be engaged by ADB in accordance with the 
Guidelines on the Use of Consultants (2013, as amended from time to time).

5.  The outline terms of reference for the consultants are outlined in the paras below.  
 
1.  Railway Engineering Advisor (International, 4.5 PMs) 
6.  Undertake, but will not be limited to, the following tasks: (i) review and consolidate due 
diligence of the project including overall scope, engineering, cost estimate, safeguards and 
other relevant areas; (ii) update the sector roadmap for the project using problem tree analysis; 
(iii) review areas for institutional strengthening in the context of extending electrification and 
introduction of higher speeds on main routes and make proposals as to assistance needed in 
institutional and operational reforms; and (iv) assist in TOR preparation for and evaluation of 
other experts and/or firm, and as the coordinator coordinating with other experts to ensure 
timely and quality delivery of all outputs. Qualification: Bachelor’s degree with professional work 
experience of 10 years, recognized as an expert in railway engineering and transportation 
specialization;  capable  of  coordinating  contributions  of  specialists  in  other  disciplines  to 
complete a joint report/s as per the ADB’s requirements; Working experience or knowledge of 
ADB’s operations will be desirable; Must have proven analytical skills and working experience in 
ADB developing member countries; Uzbekistan project experience would be preferred. 
 
2.  Railway Engineer/Coordinator (National, 5 PMs) 
7.  Assist international consultants in gathering in-depth information and preparing project 
documents. More specifically, the expert will undertake but will not be limited to the following 
tasks: (i) provide overall coordination and all necessary assistance to all international experts 
and consolidate their outputs in accordance with the Uzbekistan government requirements;

10  Appendix 3 
(ii) review preliminary designs including safety aspects during construction and operation, and 
rail line maintenance; (iii) update the cost estimates; (iv) assist international transport economist 
with  the  demand  forecasts  for  the  proposed  railway;  and  (v)  prepare  an  implementation 
schedule. Qualification: Bachelor’s degree in railway engineering specialization; familiar with 
Uzbekistan railway practices and five or more years’ railway project experience; preferably good 
skill in written and spoken English; ADB project experience is an added advantage. 
 
3.  Procurement and Contract Specialist (International, 3 PMs) 
8.  Undertake field works with the executing agency and assist in preparation of relevant 
project documents. More specifically, the expert will undertake but will not be limited to the 
following  tasks:  (i)  undertake  procurement  activities  including  EA’s  procurement  capacity 
assessment in line with ADB’s Procurement Guidelines (2013, as updated) and Guidelines on 
the use of Consultants (2013, as updated); (ii) prepare bidding documents and request for 
proposals documents; (iii) receive, open, and assist EA in the procedures for obtaining ADB no-
objection on evaluation of proposals, finalization of contracts, and the processes for contractor 
mobilization; and (iv) train EA staff on ADB procurement requirements and on EPC/Turnkey 
contract management. Qualification: relevant Bachelor's degree with preferably 10 or more 
years’ work experience in international bidding and procurement; excellent analytical skills and 
working experience in ADB developing member countries; prior experience of ADB projects in 
Uzbekistan is a preference.  
 
4.  Transport Economist (International, 1.5 PMs) 
9.  Undertake, but not be limited to, the following tasks: (i) review the railway corridor 
feasibility study (F/S) done by UTY and meet with the government, executing agency, and other 
stakeholders  to  gather  in-depth  information  to  update  the  traffic  forecast;  (ii)  review 
macroeconomic and sector contexts, conduct demand analysis, identify project rationale and 
alternatives;  (iii)  identify  and  compare  project  costs  and  benefits  (including  additional 
environmental benefits from electrification), assess project sustainability, conduct sensitivity and 
risk  analysis,  and  identify  indicators  for  project  performance  monitoring  system;  and  
(iv) coordinate with other experts in order to produce a cohesive joint report for processing the 
project for ADB financing. Qualification: Bachelor’s degree in economics or equivalent with 
broad-based work experience (a minimum of 10 years of relevant professional experience) 
recognized as an expert in transport economics; proven analytical skills and working experience 
in ADB developing member countries; Uzbekistan experience would be preferred. 
 
5.  Financial Specialist (International, 2 PMs) 
10.  Undertake, but not be limited to, the following tasks: (i) review the railway corridor F/S 
and prepare the financing plan; (ii) carry out the financial analysis and determine financial 
internal rate of return and weighted average cost of capital computations and evaluate the 
financial viability of the investment; (iii) prepare an updated financial management assessment 
(pertaining to UTY); (iv) identify key risks and carry out sensitivity analysis; and identify actions 
to ensure project sustainability and propose related assurances or covenants; and (v) review 
ongoing  and  planned  reform  actions  and  propose  any  additional  measures  considered 
necessary for institutional strengthening, particularly in the areas of financial management and 
financing  modalities.  Qualification:  Bachelor’s  degree  and  a  broad-based  work  experience  
(10 years of relevant professional experience) recognized as an expert in transport financial 
analysis; proven analytical skills and working experience in ADB developing member countries, 
with a recognized accountancy qualification such as a Chartered Accountant, Certified Public 
Accountant or Chartered Certified Accountant; Uzbekistan experience would be preferred.

Appendix 3  11 
 
6.  Environmental Specialist (International, 1 PM; National, 3 PMs) 
11.  Work as a team to undertake but will not be limited to the following works:  
•  Prepare  Initial  Environmental  Examination  (IEE)  Report  and  its  Summary  or 
Environmental  Impact  Assessment  (EIA)  Report  and  its  Summary  if  it  is 
warranted. The IEE/EIA report should be prepared in accordance to the ADB’s 
Safeguard Policy Statement 2009 for Environmental Assessment Requirement. 
The report should include the environmental management and monitoring plan. 
•  Assess the capacity of the Government in addressing environmental problems 
including  the  institutional  arrangements  and  any  capacity  building  measures 
need  to  be  elaborated,  and  propose  the  review  procedure  for  addressing 
environmental  concerns  of  the  Project,  and  on  this  basis,  prepare 
recommendation on how the recommendation of IEE or EIA will be implemented.  
•  Reconfirm the environmental classification of the proposed project 
•  If the existing facilities will be rehabilitated or reconstructed as part of the Project, 
undertake environmental audit to check whether the existing facilities complied 
with the Government environmental requirement, and its compliance with ADB’s 
environmental safeguards requirement. Any discrepancies or incompliance should 
be provided proposed corrective actions. The Environmental Compliance Audit 
Report could be attached as appendix of the IEE, or as separate report. 
12.  Qualification: For International consultant relevant education background to undertake 
environmental impact assessment works and significant experience for preparing environmental 
impact assessment for similar projects, and be familiar with implementation of Uzbekistan’s 
environmental protection law; preferably a master degree and at least 5 years’ experience in 
work related with environmental impact assessment. Familiarity with the ADB Safeguards Policy 
Statement (SPS) 2009 is an advantage. For national consultant  relevant education background 
to prepare environmental impact assessment and some experience on preparing environmental 
impact assessment of project in Uzbekistan, and well knowledge of Uzbekistan’s environmental 
law and regulation; preferably undergraduate degree with at least 3 years’ experience. 
 
7.  Resettlement Specialist (International, 1 PM; National, 5 PMs) 
13.  Work as a team to undertake but will not be limited to the following work:  
•  Reconfirm  the  project  classification  for  Involuntary  Resettlement  (IR)  and 
Indigenous Peoples Safeguards  
•  Prepare options to minimize land acquisition and associated impacts 
•  Prepare Resettlement Plan that sets out strategies to mitigate adverse effects 
and  maintain  living  standards  of  affected  people.  It  shall  address the  policy 
objectives of ADB and the government for land acquisition and resettlement, in 
line with the ADB SPS 2009 and relevant Government Law and Regulations 
•  Conduct  100%  survey  of  socio  economic  condition  of  affected  people,  and 
meaningful consultations  with affected people 
•  Describe  the  institutional  arrangements  for  addressing  social  impacts/risks 
associated with the project to develop grievance redress mechanism, and to 
develop effective arrangement to implement RP 
•  Prepare estimated budget for implementing RP covering all aspects.  
•  Prepare Involuntary Resettlement Compliance Audit Report as needed.  
14.  Qualification: For International Consultant relevant education background and significant 
experience in preparing RP and implementing land acquisition and resettlement in Central Asia 
especially for projects in Uzbekistan; full understanding of the ADB SPS 2009; preferably a

master  degree  and  over  7  years’  experience  and  at  least  3  years’  work  as  resettlement 
specialist.  For  national  consultant  relevant  education  background  to  undertake  survey, 
consultations  as  part  of  RP  preparation  and  some  experience  in  preparing  RP  with  full 
understanding on Uzbekistan law and regulation on land acquisition; preferably undergraduate 
degree from land management institute  with at least 3 years’ related work experience.  
 
8.  Social Development Specialist (National, 3 PMs) 
15.  Undertake but will not be limited to the following work:  
•  Conduct    social  impact  assessment  other  than  social  aspects  covered  by 
safeguards  requirement,  especially  poverty  assessment,  gender  assessment, 
participatory assessment, labor impacts and other social impacts as described in 
ADB guideline for social impact assessment 
•  Conduct  socio  economic  survey  to  prepare  Poverty  and  Social  Impact 
Assessment in compliance with ADB guideline for social impact assessment 
•  Propose gender classification for the project and prepare measures to comply 
with such classification, including gender action plan if it is warranted 
•  Prepare  a  summary  poverty  reduction  and  social  strategy  including  gender 
strategy and/or measures as appropriate 
 
16.  Qualification: relevant education background to conduct social impact assessment and 
significant experience in preparing poverty and social impact assessment. Familiar with ADB’s 
policy on social impacts especially gender and poverty. Preferably master degree with at least 5 
years’ related work experience.  
 
9.  Resource Persons (3 international and 3 national consultants, up to 10 
person-day each) 
17.  Resource persons on railway signal and telecommunication, power supply, supervisory 
control and data acquisition system, electric locomotive workshop, institution development, etc. 
may be engaged during project preparation. They will provide specialized expertise to UTY as 
regards (i) recent technology development in railway electrification, operation and maintenance; 
(ii) improving the technical and cost side of UTY's feasibility study as needed; and (iii) other 
railway technical and institutional aspects as appropriate.   
 
F.   Schedule and Reporting Requirements 
18.  The consulting services will be implemented over a period of 24 months, with estimated 
TA commencement starting on 30 September 2014 and completing on 30 September 2016. TA 
funds  will  be  disbursed  in  accordance  with  ADB’s  Technical  Assistance  Disbursement 
Handbook (2010, as amended from time to time). The PPTA will be financially closed by 31 
March 2017. On a regular basis, the consultant will work closely with UTY and the local design 
institute and provide all necessary assistance in the preparation of project documents. The 
consultant will report directly to the project officer unless delegated to UTY.  
 
19.  The consultants will submit to UTY and ADB (i) an inception report 4 weeks after 
commencement of services; (ii) an interim report after three months; and (iii) a final report 
(including a five-page executive summary with key findings and recommendations) 3 weeks 
after receipt of review comments from UTY and ADB. All reports will be written in English and 
translated into Russian. Two hard copies and one soft copy of the inception, interim, and draft 
final reports (in English) will be submitted to ADB. Three hard copies and one soft copy of each 
report (in both Russian and English) will be submitted to UTY.
